negotiator.session

Class SessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.session.SessionManager

  • public class SessionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The SessionManager is responsible for enforcing the Protocol during the Session. This is the entry point for the negotiation algorithm. The protocol and session parameters are passed on from the GUI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionManager

        public SessionManager(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties,
              Protocol protocol,
              Session session)
        Initializes a new instance of the SessionManager object. After initialization this SessionManager can be run().
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties to use in this session (including agents and optionally mediators)
        protocol - The protocol to use for this session.
        session - A session object containing preset information (can also be a new instance)

      • getAgentUtils

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[]>> getAgentUtils()
        Get the history of the utilities for all agents so far. Outer list is a list of agent id's and utilities inner list is a list of double[2] where the first double identifies the round and the second double identifies the util. Example (History of two agents with two rounds): list[0][0] = {1, 0.90} list[0][1] = {2, 0.60} list[1][0] = {1, 0.70} list[1][1] = {2, 0.80} ^ ^ ^ ^ agent ___| | | | round id ___| | | round number _____| | round utility _________|
        Returns:
        Utility history

      • getAgreementUtilities

        public double[][] getAgreementUtilities()
        Returns round number and utility value of agreement if any. If no agreement this function is undefined. result[0][0] = 2.1 <-- round number result[0][1] = 2.1 <-- round number result[1][0] = 0.40 <-- utility result[1][1] = 0.80 <-- utility
        Returns:
        The round number and utility of agreement if any.
